questions.text: What is the capital city of South Africa?
questions.explanation: South Africa has three capitals; Pretoria is the administrative capital. Cape Town is the legislative capital, Bloemfontein the judicial.

questions.text: Which data type is immutable in Python?
questions.explanation: Tuples cannot be changed after creation; lists, dicts, and sets are mutable.

questions.text: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

questions.text: In aquaponics, which fish is commonly used due to its hardiness?
questions.explanation: Tilapia are hardy, fast-growing, and tolerate a wide range of water conditions—ideal for aquaponics.

questions.text: Which planet in our solar system is known for its prominent rings?
questions.explanation: Saturn's ring system is the most extensive and prominent in the solar system.

questions.text: Which ocean borders South Africa to the west?
questions.explanation: The Atlantic Ocean borders South Africa's west coast, while the Indian Ocean borders the east.

questions.text: Which programming language is known for its snake logo?
questions.explanation: Python is represented by a snake logo, inspired by its name from 'Monty Python' comedy group.

questions.text: What is the currency of South Africa?
questions.explanation: The South African Rand (ZAR) is the official currency of South Africa.

questions.text: Which is the largest planet in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Jupiter is the largest planet, with a diameter of about 142,984 km.

questions.text: What is the process of growing plants without soil called?
questions.explanation: Hydroponics is a method of growing plants without soil, using nutrient-rich water.

questions.text: Which animal is known as the King of the Jungle?
questions.explanation: The lion is often called the King of the Jungle, though it actually lives in savannas.

questions.text: What is the boiling point of water at sea level?
questions.explanation: At sea level, water boils at 100 degrees Celsius (212 degrees Fahrenheit).

questions.text: Which continent is the Sahara Desert located on?
questions.explanation: The Sahara Desert is located in North Africa, the largest hot desert in the world.

questions.text: Which programming language is primarily used for web styling?
questions.explanation: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used for styling HTML web pages.

questions.text: What is 15 multiplied by 6?
Which is the smallest prime number?
questions.explanation: 2 is the smallest and the only even prime number.

questions.text: In which year did South Africa host the FIFA World Cup?
questions.explanation: South Africa hosted the FIFA World Cup in 2010, the first time in Africa.

questions.text: Which blood type is known as the universal donor?
questions.explanation: O negative blood can be given to patients of any blood type.

questions.text: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: Leonardo da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa in the early 16th century.

questions.text: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: The chemical symbol for gold is Au, from the Latin word 'Aurum'.
